intro: Bupleurum salicifolium var. robustum, commonly known as the robust bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, upright stems that can grow up to 1 meter in height, adorned with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers in early summer, which are followed by elliptical, dark brown seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in ecological studies of high-altitude flora.
